page_summary: This page explains the importance of disease staging in breast cancer, describing how staging reflects the extent of cancer spread and impacts both treatment and prognosis determination. It outlines that staging is based on the AJCC and UICC TNM Classification, which uses clinical and pathologic assessments involving tumor size, lymph node involvement, and metastasis. The page also mentions the role of macroscopic and microscopic examination in pathologic staging. No explicit endpoints or concrete endpoint definitions are discussed.
